ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: Learned the basics of Polish
LeRned polish
I learned the basic fundamentals of Polish and a strong foundation for the upcoming class in the spring.
I developed a great vocabluary and the ability to start simple interactions between two people. I also learned how to conjugate verbs and more.
This was a great introduction to the polish language for someone who had no prior exposure at all. Learned basic grammar, vocabulary, conversations and speaking.
I learned polish
Basic Polish adjectives and nouns, pronunciation, instrumental case.
I learned elementary level polish that would allow me to socialize in simple settings 1-on-1 in polish

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: This course is a great way to be introduced to Polish. The workload is not too much, and the prof makes sure that you are well prepared for the tests.
Good course
I loved how the course was interactive every single day. What needs to be improved is maybe more structure to the class.

Strengths: Very wise and passionate teacher, great presentation of material, very understanding towards all of her students...great course and class all around. I absolutely loved Polish and couldn't think of any ways to improve it!

This course was great because the professor is very engaged and passionate and cares about each student and their language development. The activities varied from day to day keeping the class interesting and the homework was reasonable and helpful.
The course is relatively low-stress and classwork was well spaced out through out the semester.  The course moved a bit slowly.
I felt like a lot of the homework assignments werent super useful and often they were repetitive. I wouldve liked more interesting homework.

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: I would 100% recommend this course, it is perfect to take in order to fulfill the language requirement. It is not like the other languages that will be another stresser.
Yes good class if u want to learn polish
yes!
I would recommend this course as the professor was very helpful.
Yes I will absolutely be recommending Polish to my friends!

Absolutely! Krystyna is the nicest and most caring professor Ive had at Yale and she makes learning polish fun and interesting. This course is a great introduction to a completely new language which goes at a pace where it is intellectually challenging yet completely manageable.
Yeah its a chill class
I would recommend this course to anyone who wants to learn Polish from a beginning level.  The workload of the course is very manageable.
Anyone interested in taking polish absolutely!
